content: Hi Debra! How's it going? Hope your day's going well!
Hey India! All's good here, thanks. Just went for my jog earlier, what about you? Anything fun happen lately?
I'm doing great, thanks! Last week I went to a street art fest in Brazil and it was amazing! All the art was so colorful and inspiring. Have you been to one?
Whoa, that looks awesome! Never been to a street art fest before, sounds rad! What a great piece! How long did it take to make that?
I'm pretty sure it took a few days for the artists to finish it. It was cool to watch them and see the art coming together. Do you have any fave art?
I'm a huge fan of photography, like this shot I took last week. The colors are stunning!
Wow, that's a great shot! Where was it taken?

Thanks! I took this pic at a beach in Bali. I've got a thing for traveling and seeing new places. Always bring my camera to capture moments like this. Any hobbies or interests you're passionate about?

Yup, I'm into art, as you know. My sister gave me a sketchbook for my bday and I've been sketching away in it every morning. Here's a sketch I did recently. I love it because it's so chill and therapeutic. What about you, got any hobbies you love?
Wow, that looks amazing! Do you have more? Cooking is a hobby of mine - I made a delicious dinner last week, it was great fun to mix flavors.
Cool! That looks great. Cooking's awesome! What kind is it? Here is another drawing of mine.
That's amazing! The meal was - fettuccine Alfredo with creamy garlic sauce. Comfort food at its best. What's your favorite dish/recipe you cook?

Thanks! Your pasta sounds great. Making homemade stuff is so much fun! Kneading the dough and adding toppings is so satisfying. See ya! Hi Debra! Long time no talk. How's your photography and cooking going? Got any cool pics or recipes to share?

Hey India! Been good, thanks. My photography's been good - I got some awesome shots of some scenery when I went hiking. Tried making a sushi roll and it was decent! How about you? Anything fun going on?

Ooh, stunning pic! Where's this at? I've been trying out new painting methods at the street art festival, bringing more colour to my art. Last week I did a live demonstration for my college art club - super exciting! And I just got invited to exhibit at a local gallery - yay!

Wow India, congrats on the invitation! I'm beaming with pride. That waterfall's from Yosemite, it was such a beautiful spot! By the way, I also went skydiving yesterday! The experience was insane, I can't believe I actually did it!
Oh wow! That looks really fun! How'd it go? Yosemite looks amazing. I wanna go someday!
Thanks, India! It was so exciting! Freefalling was awesome! It was super scary, but totally worth it. Yosemite's awesome - you should visit it. Anything new going on for you besides your art?
I'm learning Spanish and it's been a blast. What about you, have you ever tried learning a new language?

That's great, India! Learning a new language is a useful skill. I haven't tried it yet but it's on my list of goals. I'm currently working on starting my own business. Still in the planning phase but really excited. BTW, attended a TEDx talk recently and was super inspiring. Definitely pushed me to go for my biz dreams.

Hey Debra, congrats on starting a biz! That talk must have been really motivating. What was it about? Personally, I've just been working on a new painting technique I learned at the street are festival. Catch you later!
Hey India! How's it going? Making any cool artwork lately?

Hi Debra! Doing great, thanks. My art's going great. I'm doing a new series of abstracts based on my trip and testing out watercolors now. Also, I am preparing them for the gallery exhibition. You doing anything new with photography or cooking lately?
That sounds great, India! I'd love to see your new experiments. I'm trying to get better at photography, and I took a great shot of this on my morning jog today. Such a peaceful moment!
Woah, Debra, it looks amazing! It looks so alive and those dewdrops are so cool. Where'd you take it?

Thanks, India! I snapped that pic at a botanical garden near me. It's one of my fave places to go on a peaceful morning jog. There's all sorts of flowers and plants, so it's like a feast for the eyes.
Sounds great! Any tips on taking pics like that flower one? I'm looking to up my photo game, especially for nature shots.
Capturing details is key - get close, try different angles, and use the golden hours of sunrise and sunset. I'm happy to share more tips and examples. Here's a shot from my Greece trip!
Thanks so much for the advice, Debra! I'll keep that in mind. Wow, your photo is stunning! How was the trip? do you have any highlights from it?

Thanks, India! It was awesome. I loved exploring the ancient ruins of Athens. Walking through history and imagining what life was like ages ago was so cool! I also got to try some yummy Greek food like moussaka and souvlaki. Here's a pic of one of the things I saw - wow!

That is amazing! Where did you take the pic? Greece looks so cool. BTW, I backpacked around Europe last week and loving it! Exploring new places everyday, can't wait to see what the next month brings.
Thanks for the kind words, India! That photo is from my trip. Wow, backpacking through Europe! You'll be sure to have some amazing adventures. Any special places you're excited to check out next?
Thanks, Debra! I'm stoked for Amsterdam. Heard lots of nice stuff about their art scene. Can't wait to explore the museums and galleries. Ever been to Amsterdam?
Haven't been there yet but it's on my list. Art is amazing there so take lots of pics and share! Bye!

Hi Debra! How's it going? Hoping you've had an awesome week. Last week I finally visited the Louvre in Paris! It was amazing - the art was incredible! Seeing the Mona Lisa was a highlight. Have you ever been there?
Hey India! Great to hear from you. Wow, visiting that place - sounds amazing. Haven't been yet but it's in my bucket list. Bet seeing that famous painting in person was unreal!
It was amazing! Standing in front of it was out of this world. I was totally in awe - had to take a pic! Wanna see?
Wow, what a cool sight! Did you talk to anyone there?
Nah, most people at the exhibit spoke French. But it was awesome seeing the famous painting in person! Have you been to any art museums recently?

I haven't been to any lately, but I went to a local gallery last month. I saw some amazing contemporary art from local artists. I thought it was really inspiring. Here's a photo I took of a painting I liked.
Wow, nice artwork! What made you pick it?
Thanks! I liked the vivid colors and how they seemed to jump out at me. It made me think of how powerful art can be. Speaking of learning, how's your language going? Any progress since we spoke?
Wow, Debra, I've been having a blast learning Italian and German in Europe. I'm armed with some basic phrases and greetings and made a few friends too. Do you know any other languages?

That's awesome, India! Learning languages while traveling is a really cool way to get to know the culture. I'm kinda obsessed with languages too, but I haven't perfected any. I did take Spanish in high school though, but I haven't kept up with it. Gotta get on that someday! Oh, and I'm planning my solo trip to five countries! Exciting stuff.
Wow, Debra! 5 countries, awesome! Where're you headed? Need help planning or any tips? Count me in!

Thanks a lot, India! Any tips you can give me about these countries would be great. I'm heading to Thailand, Italy, Australia, Brazil and Iceland - so much to see! I'm looking forward to taking in the sights and experiencing new cultures. Have you been to any of them?

Woah, sounds like an awesome trip! Haven't been to any of those places - but I bet they're great. Here's my 2 cents - when in Thailand, gotta check out Phuket's stunning beaches and Chiang Mai's ancient temples. In Italy, make it a must-do to explore the Amalfi Coast - plus seek out Rome's yummy gelato. Australia's gotta be seen for its stunning landscapes, so make sure you explore!
Thanks a million for the recommendations, India! Can't wait to hit up some of those places! Last weekend I took my bro and sis on a weekend trip to a nearby city. We had a blast exploring.
Sounds like a fun weekend, Debra! Exploring new places with loved ones is great. Any fav moments to share?
We had the best time at Adventure Land! We went on rollers coasters, played games and laughed non-stop - it was so fun.
